data.content:
Động từ
trích dẫn, dẫn
she cited [a verse from] [a poem] by Keats
chị ta trích dẫn [một câu thơ của] Keats
dẫn chứng, dẫn
she cited the high unemployment figures as evidence of the failure of government policy
chị ta dẫn con số thất nghiệp cao như một bằng chứng cho sự thất bại của chính sách của chính phủ
(từ Mỹ) tuyên dương (lính)
(luật học) gọi ra tòa
be cited in divorce proceedings
được gọi ra tòa trong một vụ kiện ly hôn

verb
cites; cited; citing
[+ obj] to write or say the words of (a book, author, etc.) :quote
The article cites several experts on the subject.
to mention (something) especially as an example or to support an idea or opinion
The museum had often been cited as an example of successful fund-raising.
He cited evidence suggesting she was in the area when the crime was committed.
law :to order (someone) to appear before a court of law
She was cited for reckless driving.
to officially and publicly honor (someone) for something done
She was cited for bravery.
